final_answer.explanation: The vessel laid down on 30 March 1940 at the Blohm & Voss yard in Hamburg as yard number 542 is the German submarine U-566. This submarine was launched on 20 February 1941 and commissioned on 17 April 1941. U-566 was scuttled by her crew on 24 October 1943 after sustaining damage from six depth charges dropped by a British Wellington aircraft. The location of U-566 at the time of her scuttling was in the North Atlantic, specifically west of Portugal, as indicated by the coordinates provided in the data. Therefore, the location associated with the vessel's cause of loss is the North Atlantic.
